oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Discussion - Gender and Country Music - 2005-05-30
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Panel discussion surrounding the release of the book of essays titled “A Boy Named Sue: Gender and Country Music” from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on May 30, 2005.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kris McCusker; Diane Pecknold; Beverly Keel; Michael Bertrand; Jocelyn Neal; Barbara Ching;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Recording begins in progress. Includes comments and questions from audience (off mic). Opening comments by Michael Gray (off mic). Introduction of panelists. Introduction of moderator Diane Pecknold. Subjects include; Conservative values in country music -- Comparisons between rock and roll music and country music -- Elvis Presley's influence and his outlook -- Images of women in music -- Continuum of women singing in the home, in church and on records -- Women as taste makers -- Radio play aimed at women who run households -- Nashville Sound rhetoric -- Masculinity in country music -- Themes in country music appealing to women -- Elvis being representative of an entire generation of people and creating an identity -- Women's projection of escapist fantasy by Conway Twitty -- Comparing Girls Night Out songs with Honky Tonk Angels and Couples Out To Dance songs -- Shania Twain watershed impact and comparisons between her and Kathy Mattea --

Perceived country audience lack of acceptance of Gay and Lesbian lifestyle -- Observed response to two women dancing in a bar -- Dixie Chicks -- Gretchen Wilson -- Loretta Lynn -- The songs Redneck Woman and You're Looking At Country -- Shifts in country music and it's reaction to those shifts -- Songwriter Erin Enderlin and her attempts to understand her audience and who she's writing to -- Country music expanding beyond it's middle class roots -- K. D. Lang impact -- Visibility of women in the country music industry -- Lily May Ledford story -- Cyclical nature of pop culture and country music -- closing comments -- Recording continues after discussion is concluded.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Tape labeled as Sex, Lies and Country Music by AV staff. Program title assigned by cataloger taken from comments.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: McClusker, Kris; Pecknold, Diane; Keel, Beverly; Bertrand, Michael; Ching, Barbara; Neal, Jocelyn; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
